intro: Pseudorhipsalis amazonica subsp. panamensis, commonly known as the Panamanian star cactus, is a member of the Cactaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly Panama and parts of Colombia. This succulent plant features a branched stem with numerous small, rounded stems that are often covered in a fine, white powdery coating. The flowers are typically small, white or pale yellow, and appear in clusters at the ends of the stems. It is well adapted to humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil to thrive.
